title: Now this is just Unprofessional
body:
http://i.imgur.com/kQxL0oA.png

I know that this is probably super low-tier on the "things to fix" list but the comma right after the Supported Game Modes line looks incredibly unprofessional. My guess is that when Clarity and Clairvoyance were removed from Summoner's Rift back in Season 5, their listings were updated but the separating Comma didn't go with it. Please just fix it, it's activating all my OCD alarms at once.

replies.body: Ah this bugger!. I investigated this one personally a few weeks ago, and the unfortunate resolution was that we weren't going to fix it. The code for that is in a pretty old system, and there's only a few peeps who worked in that system a few years ago. I verified with the team working on the new client that the issue no longer persists with the update, so we left it for now given the time it would take one of those engineers to stop their work, relearn the old system, find where the problem was, fix it and all that fun stuff just wasn't justifiable given what they're priorities are currently.
Ah ok. At least you guys know about it and have a solution. Man, is the old code really that archaic? Sounds like it's the equivalent of being sent back to the 1970s and being told "Make video game".

Food for thought: LoL was developed to be an advancement on a popular game mod (DotA) that was released for an already old game (Warcraft).
It was a super niche audience at the time. The fact that LoL even made it off the ground is surprising.
Now it's the #1 video game in the world.

Pretty safe bet the old code was never designed to handle what the game is today.
. . . Which is probably why Nidalee always finds a new way to create invisible spears. ;p

Not to mention most of the original developers didn't have much of a professional background.

It's not so difficult to write working code, but to produce good code you need to be familiar with certain rules and procedures.
https://xkcd.com/1513/

Essentially the old code was made with incredibly small goals and targets in mind, and was also shoddily put together. The reason "Spaghetti Code" is a thing is because of that; you never know just what will break next because of how awfully written the code for the game has consistently been. Thankfully systems have since been rewritten in places but it's not perfect.
I'm noticing that's an ongoing trend with you guys, theres a problem and you {{champion:96}} aren't{{champion:133}}  going{{champion:24}}  to{{champion:11}}  fix {{champion:5}}  it.
Balance is one thing. Spaghetti code and underlying system structure is a *completely* different monster. Which is why they're not the same team.

it's all code bro. you find where it is in the iteration process or in the GUI, go through lines of code and correct it. I'm  stating that they seem to treat balance, user interface, and game features like commas and missing text lines if it seems like too much work or time they aren't going to fix it or they are just gonna remove them. when you're a code monkey this is expected of you. You're not understanding that this is people's jobs to fix or maintain this stuff and they aren't doing their job. This is why Riot is going slash and burn on alot of features and why we're getting less content instead of more.
